nodes.bodyText:
No, this should remain here. And I think the shutdown.compareAndSet() should likely stay here as well. I don't want the RealChannel to manage the wider ManagedChannel API.
I'd much rather RealChannel make one-two calls to shutdown instead of taking control over it itself, since there's lots of existing uses. Even if we have to assume that shutdown.compareAndSet is the first thing done in the shutdown process.
Why have this block of code? Won't the Shutdown Runnable do the same thing? Ditto for shutdownNow.

This is to keep the fast path as https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/blob/v1.32.0/core/src/main/java/io/grpc/internal/ManagedChannelImpl.java#L791
I don't mind if delete the fast path. Could there be any impact?
I don't understand. Why do we need a fast path? Why do you think the old path was a "fast path"? Won't the "slow" path be virtually the same speed, although it could be delayed a bit in time.

The only difference between "fast path" and  "slow path" is the former may eagerly set delayedTransport.shutdown = true. I think it's pretty safe to remove the fast path.
Removed.
Oh, I was planning to do it unconditionally in simplify PendingCallRemoval but forgot.
